DOC.brief_summary: The overall objective propose study test , among Canadian family , comparative effectiveness 2 different version ( dos ) family-based obesity prevention intervention tailor family ' behavioural risk profile . To achieve objective , conduct randomize controlled trial family child age 18 months- 5 year . Families randomize 1 3 condition : 1 ) Monthly email general health information ( Attention Control ) , 2 ) Tailored weekly email 2 home visit health educator ( Email +2 ) , 3 ) Tailored weekly email 4 home visit ( Email +4 ) . The intervention last 6 month , follow-up 12-months post-intervention ( 18 month baseline ) . We examine impact intervention child 's body composition , weight-related behaviour , biomarkers diabetes cardiovascular disease risk . We hypothesize , compare child Attention Control , child Email +2 Email +4 condition achieve : 1. small increase adiposity ( primary outcome ) , age- gender-specific body mass index ( BMI ) , 6-month intervention period . 2. high frequency family meal , child 's sleep duration , physical activity , fruit vegetable intake lower child 's sugar-sweetened beverage intake , sedentary behaviour 6-month intervention period . ( secondary outcome ) 3. low diastolic blood pressure , glycosylated hemoglobin , fast glucose , fast insulin , Low Density Lipoprotein ( LDL ) cholesterol , triglyceride , C-reactive protein , trans saturate fat , high High Density Lipoprotein ( HDL ) cholesterol 6-month intervention period . We hypothesize significant difference outcome child condition 2 ( Email +2 ) 4 ( Email +4 ) home visit .
DOC.brief_title: Guelph Family Health Study : Pilot Study
DOC.criteria: family child age 18 month 5 year live Guelph area parent respond questionnaire English family plan move study period child severe health condition ( severe cerebral palsy ) would prohibit participate study activity
